results.title: Historical marine paintings by Richard Linton
results.brief_description: Richard Linton was born in Melbourne in 1935. He began working in photolithography after studying at the Australian School of Printing. His first serious painting of a sailing ship was in 1957. His love of history and meticulous attention to detail make him a world authority on the subject and unique in today’s art world. With his knowledge of printing he also produces limited edition prints of his works. In this video, Richard Linton explains his working process, including researching and painting, and talks about his paintings of Australian and overseas built sailing ships.

results.title: His Majesty
results.brief_description: Animated film about a king losing his temper. Suddenly we see that the king is only a chess piece on a board and he becomes meek.

results.title: Hillary ventures south
results.brief_description: A documentary chronicling a visit to Tasmania by Sir Edmund Hillary. He arrives, meets some dignitaries, surveys some national park areas to the south of Hobart, then joins a bushwalking club to scale Mount Mawson. The film focusses on what a thrill it is for these youngsters to climb alonside the man who scaled Everest. Hillary, the narrator tells us, says Tasmania has some of the greatest tramping country in the world.

results.title: High Ground
results.brief_description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.

results.title: Help yourself to a better back
results.brief_description: This tape offers a brief but fairly comprehensive introduction to safe workplace practice and back care in both office and industrial settings. For office workers the main cause of back injury is sitting for long periods, without breaks and without varying the pose of the body. This video suggests a series of simple exercises that take just a couple of minutes, and can be performed at the desk or in a restricted area. For workers in industry the main risk is lifting. The video provides a simple and easy to follow checklist of things to remember when lifting. It also provides details of good lifting and carrying techniques.

results.title: Heidi Di Santo's guide to relaxation
results.brief_description: Heidi Di Santo teaches a relaxation technique to assist with combating stress in the workplace. Stress is something which affects the productivity of most workplaces, and this video offers suggestions on how to minimize the stress and increase productivity.

results.title: Heavy petting
results.brief_description: Using footage from Hollywood in the 50’s and 60’s and educational material from the era, known personalities reflect on what it was like to be a living, breathing, sexual being in the 1950’s or 60’s. People such as Allan Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Sandra Bernhard, Francis Fisher, Frederic Lahey, John Oates and Zoe Tamerlaine discuss issues such as; dating, masturbation, petting, falling in love, menstruation, things you did to look cool, cruising, parties, dances, teen pregnancy, STD, and all the other concerns surrounding being a teenager. Set to a soundtrack of music from the decades in question, this snappy and entertaining documentary presents the viewer with a slice of 50’s and 60’s nostalgia.
